FileOperationPattern.description:
A pattern to describe in which file operation requests or notifications
the server is interested in.

glob.description:
The glob pattern to match. Glob patterns can have the following syntax:
- `*` to match one or more characters in a path segment
- `?` to match on one character in a path segment
- `**` to match any number of path segments, including none
- `{}` to group conditions (e.g. `**​/*.{ts,js}` matches all TypeScript and JavaScript files)
- `[]` to declare a range of characters to match in a path segment (e.g., `example.[0-9]` to match on `example.0`, `example.1`, …)
- `[!...]` to negate a range of characters to match in a path segment (e.g., `example.[!0-9]` to match on `example.a`, `example.b`, but not `example.0`)

matches.description:
Whether to match files or folders with this pattern.

Matches both if undefined.

FileOperationPatternKind.description:
A pattern kind describing if a glob pattern matches a file a folder or
both.

FileOperationPatternOptions.description: Matching options for the file operation pattern.

ignoreCase.description: The pattern should be matched ignoring casing.
